3-3-1: DEFINITIONS:
For the purpose of this Chapter, the following definitions shall apply:
GROSS RECEIPTS: A. The consideration received for the transmission of messages,
or for distributing, supplying, furnishing or selling gas, or electricity for
use or consumption and not for resale, as the case may be; and for all services
rendered in connection therewith valued in money, whether received in money or
otherwise, including cash, credit, services and property of every kind and
material, and for all services rendered therewith; and shall be determined
without any deduction on account of the cost of transmitting said messages
without any deduction on account of the cost of the service, product or
commodity supplied, at the cost of materials used, labor or service cost, or
any other expenses whatsoever.
   B.   As pertains to the "gross receipts" from the telephone company
servicing the City, "gross receipts" means the consideration received for
supplying telephone service, and for all services rendered in connection
therewith valued in money, whether received in money or otherwise, including
cash, credit, services and property of every kind and material, and for all
services rendered therewith; and shall be determined without any deduction on
account of the cost of the service, product or commodity supplied, the cost of
materials used, labor or service cost, and any other expenses whatsoever.
PERSON MAINTAINING A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THIS STATE: Any person having or
maintaining within this State, directly or by a subsidiary or other affiliate,
an office, generation facility, distribution facility, transmission facility,
sales office or other place of business, or any employee, agent or other
representative operating within this State under the authority of the person or
its subsidiary or other affiliate, irrespective of whether such place of
business or agent or other representative is located in this State permanently
or temporarily, or whether such person, subsidiary or other affiliate is
licensed or qualified to do business in this State.
PERSONS: Any natural individual, firm, trust, estate, partnership, association,
joint stock company, joint adventure, corporation, municipal corporation or
political subdivision of the State, or a receiver, trustee, conservator or the
representative appointed by order of court. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no
Municipal utility tax shall be assessed upon bills for utility service rendered
to the Municipality itself.
PURCHASE AT RETAIL: Any acquisition of electricity by a purchaser for purposes
of use or consumption, and not for resale, but shall not include the use of
electricity by a public utility, as defined in section 8-11-2 of the Illinois
Municipal Code 1 , directly in the generation, production, transmission,
delivery or sale of electricity.
PURCHASER: Any person who uses or consumes, within the corporate limits of the
City, electricity acquired in a purchase at retail, other than from an exempt
purchaser.
TRANSMITTING MESSAGES: In addition to the usual and popular meaning of a
person-to-person communication, shall include the furnishing, for a
consideration, of services or facilities (whether owned or leased) or both, to
persons in connection with the transmission of messages where such persons do
not, in turn, receive any consideration in connection therewith, but shall not
include such furnishing of services or facilities to persons of the
transmission of messages to the extent that any such services or facilities for
the transmission of messages are furnished for a consideration, by such persons
to other persons, for the transmission of messages. (1997 Code; amd. Ord. 99-
05, 6-14-1999)
 
Notes
1 1. 65 ILCS 5/8-11-2.
3-3-2: TAX IMPOSED:
A tax is imposed on all persons engaged in the following occupations or
privileges:
   A.   Electricity:
      1.   Tax:
         a.   Pursuant to section 8-11-2 of the Illinois Municipal Code 1  and
any and all other applicable authority, a tax is imposed upon the privilege of
using or consuming electricity acquired in a purchase at retail and used or
consumed within the corporate limits of the City at the following rates,
calculated on a monthly basis for each purchaser:
            (1)   For the first 2,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a
month: $0.004514 per kilowatt-hour;
            (2)   For the next 48,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a
month: $0.002962 per kilowatt-hour;
            (3)   For the next 50,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a
month: $0.002664 per kilowatt-hour;
            (4)   For the next 400,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a
month: $0.002590 per kilowatt-hour;
            (5)   For the next 500,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a
month: $0.002516 per kilowatt-hour;
            (6)   For the next 2,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a
month: $0.002368 per kilowatt-hour;
            (7)   For the next 2,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a
month: $0.002331 per kilowatt-hour;
            (8)   For the next 5,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a
month: $0.002294 per kilowatt-hour;
            (9)   For the next 10,000,000 kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a
month: $0.002257 per kilowatt-hour;
            (10)   For all electricity used or consumed in excess of 20,000,000
kilowatt-hours used or consumed in a month: $0.002220 per kilowatt-hour.
         b.   The tax is in addition to all taxes, fees and other revenue
measures imposed by the City, the State or any other political subdivision of
the State.
         c.   Notwithstanding any other provision of this subsection, the tax
shall not be imposed if and to the extent that imposition or collection of the
tax would violate the Constitution or statutes of the United States or the
constitution of the State of Illinois.
         d.   The tax shall be imposed with respect to the use or consumption
of electricity by residential customers beginning with the first bill issued on
or after August 1, 1999; and with respect to the use or consumption of
electricity by nonresidential customers beginning with the first bill issued to
such customers for delivery services in accordance with section 16-104 of the
Public Utilities Act 2 , or the first bill issued to such customers on or after
January 1, 2001, whichever issuance occurs sooner.
      2.   Collection Of Tax:
         a.   Subject to the provision of this subsection regarding the
delivery of electricity to resellers, the tax imposed under this Chapter shall
be collected from purchasers by the person maintaining a place of business in
this State who delivers electricity to such purchasers. This tax shall
constitute a debt of the purchaser to the person who delivers the electricity
to the purchaser and is recoverable at the same time and in the same manner as
the original charge for delivering the electricity.
         b.   Any tax required to be collected by this subsection, and any tax
in fact collected, shall constitute a debt owed to the City by the person
delivering the electricity, provided, that the person delivering electricity
shall be allowed credit for such tax related to deliveries of electricity the
charges for which are written off as uncollectible, and provided further, that
if such charges are thereafter collected, the delivering supplier shall be
obligated to remit such tax.
         c.   Persons delivering electricity shall collect the tax from the
purchaser by adding such tax to the gross charge for delivering the electricity
shall also be authorized to add to such gross charge an amount equal to three
percent (3%) of the tax they collect to reimburse them for their expense
incurred in keeping records, billing customers, preparing the filing returns,
remitting the tax and supplying data to the City upon request.
      3.   Tax Remittance And Return:
         a.   Every tax collector shall, on a monthly basis, file a return on a
form prescribed by the City. The return and accompanying remittance shall be
due on or before the last day of the month.
         b.   Following the month during which the tax is collected of or is
required to be collected of or is required to be collected under subsection A2
of this Section.
         c.   If the person delivering electricity fails to collect the tax
from the purchaser or is excused from collecting the tax under subsection A4 of
this Section, then the purchaser shall file a return in a form prescribed by
the City and pay the tax directly to the City on or before the last day of the
month following the month during which the electricity is used or consumed.
      4.   Resales:
         a.   Electricity that is delivered to a person in the City shall be
considered to be for use and consumption by that person unless the person
receiving the electricity has an active resale number issued by the Director of
Finance and furnishes that number to the person who delivers the electricity
and certifies to that person that the sale is either entirely or partially
nontaxable as a sale for resale.
         b.   If a person who receives electricity in the Municipality claims
to be an authorized reseller of electricity, that person shall apply to the
Municipal Clerk for a resale number. The application shall state facts showing
why it is not liable for the tax imposed by this subsection on any purchases of
electricity and shall furnish such additional information as the Director of
Finance may reasonably require.
         c.   Upon approval of the application, the Director of Finance shall
assign a resale number to the applicant and shall certify the number to the
applicant.
         d.   The Director of Finance may cancel the resale number of any
person if the person fails to pay any tax payable under this subsection for
electricity used or consumed by the person, or if the number: 1) was obtained
through misrepresentation, or 2) is no longer necessary because the person has
discontinued making resales.
         e.   (1) If a reseller has acquired electricity partly for use or
consumption and partly for resale, the reseller shall pay the tax imposed by
this subsection directly to the City pursuant to subsection A2b of this Section
on the amount of electricity that the reseller uses or consumes, and shall
collect the tax pursuant to subsection A1 of this Section and remit the tax
pursuant to subsection A3 of this Section on the amount of electricity
delivered by the reseller to a purchaser.
            (2)   Any person who delivers electricity to a reseller having an
active resale number and complying with all other conditions of this subsection
shall be excused from collecting and remitting the tax on any portion of the
electricity delivered to the reseller, provided that the person reports to the
municipality the total amount of electricity delivered to the reseller, and
such other information that the city may reasonably require.
      5.   Books And Records: Every tax collector, and every taxpayer required
to pay the tax imposed by this subsection shall keep accurate books and records
of its business or activity, including contemporaneous books and records
denoting the transactions that gave rise, or may have given rise, to any tax
liability under this subsection. The books and records shall be subject to and
available for inspection at all times during business hours of the day.
      6.   Statute Of Limitations: No action to recover any amount of tax due
under the provisions of this subsection A shall be commenced more than three
(3) years after the due date of such amount.
      7.   Penalties: Any taxpayer who fails to make a return, or who makes a
fraudulent return, or who wilfully violates any other provision of this
subsection A is guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction thereof, shall be
fined not less than one hundred dollars ($100.00) nor more than five hundred
dollars ($500.00), and in addition shall be liable in a civil action for the
amount of tax due. (Ord. 99-05, 6-14-1999)
   B.   Simplified Municipal Telecommunications Tax: The rate of the simplified
municipal telecommunications tax imposed under the provisions of sections 5-25
and 5-30 of the simplified municipal telecommunications tax act, PA 92-0526 is
6.0 percent (in 1/4 percent increments) that shall take effect for all gross
charges billed by telecommunications retailers on and after January 1, 2003.
(Ord. 08-02, 9-9-2002)
   C.   Gas: Persons engaged in the business of distributing, supplying,
furnishing or selling gas for use or consumption within the corporate limits of
the city, and not for resale, at the rate of five percent (5%) of the gross
receipts therefrom. (1997 Code)
 
Notes
1 1. 65 ILCS 5/8-11-2.
2 1. 220 ILCS 5/16-104.
3-3-3: EXEMPTIONS; REGULATIONS:
No tax is imposed by this chapter with respect to any transaction in interstate
commerce or otherwise to the extent to which such business may not, under the
constitution and statutes of the United States, be made subject to taxation by
this state or any political subdivision thereof; nor shall any persons engaged
in the business of distributing, supplying, furnishing or selling gas or
electricity, or engaged in the business of transmitting messages be subject to
taxation by this state or any political subdivision thereof; nor shall any
persons engaged in the business of distributing, supplying, furnishing or
selling gas or electricity, or engaged in the business of transmitting messages
be subject to taxation under the provisions of this chapter for such
transactions as are or may become subject to taxation under the provisions of
the "municipal retailers' occupation tax act" authorized by statute and this
code. (Ord. 99-05, 6-14-1999)
3-3-4: TAX AS ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION:
Such tax shall be in addition to the payment of money, or value of products or
services furnished to the municipality by the taxpayer as compensation from the
use of its streets, alleys or other public places, or installation and
maintenance therein, thereon, or thereunder of poles, wires, pipes or other
equipment used in the operation of the taxpayer's business. (Ord. 99-05, 6-14-
1999)
3-3-5: RETURN FILED:
   A.   Initial Return: On or before June 30, each taxpayer not otherwise
hereinbefore paying said tax, shall make a return to the city treasurer for the
months of March, April, and May stating:
      1.   His/her name;
      2.   His/her principal place of business;
      3.   His/her gross receipts during those months on the basis of which the
tax is imposed;
      4.   Amount of tax;
      5.   Such other and related information as the corporate authorities may
require.
   B.   Subsequent Returns: On or before the last day of every third month
thereafter, each taxpayer shall make a like return to the city treasurer for a
corresponding three (3) month period. (1997 Code)
3-3-6: PAYMENT:
The taxpayer making the return hereinbefore provided for shall, at the time of
making such return, pay to the city treasurer the amount of tax herein imposed;
provided, that in connection with any return, the taxpayer may, if he/she so
elects report and pay an amount based upon his/her total billings of business
subject to the tax during the period for which the return is made exclusive of
any amount previously billed, with prompt adjustments of later payments based
upon any difference between such billings and the taxable gross receipts. (1997
Code)
3-3-7: CREDIT FOR OVERPAYMENT:
If it shall appear that an amount of tax has been paid which was not due under
the provisions of this chapter, whether as the result of a mistake of fact or
an error of law, then such amount shall be credited against any tax due, or to
become due, under this chapter from the taxpayer who made the erroneous
payment; provided that no amounts erroneously paid more than three (3) years
prior to the filing of a claim therefor, shall be so credited. If a taxpayer
under this chapter is unable to use a credit authorized by this chapter solely
because the tax imposed by this chapter has been replaced by the tax imposed
under subsection 3-3-2A of this chapter then the taxpayer may apply such credit
against any tax due under subsection 3-3-2A of this chapter. (Ord. 99-05, 6-14-
1999)
3-3-8: PAYMENTS FROM CITY:
Payments made by the city to persons subject to this chapter shall not be
included in the gross receipts of that person and the city shall be exempt from
any charges by such person as are allowed by law because of this chapter. (1997
Code)
CHAPTER 4
AUTOMATIC AMUSEMENT DEVICES; AMUSEMENT ARCADES 1
SECTION:
3-4-1: Definitions
3-4-2: License Required
3-4-3: Application; Fee
3-4-4: Term
3-4-5: Premises Requirements
3-4-6: Denial, Revocation Or Suspension
3-4-7: Hearing Procedure
3-4-8: General Requirements And Restrictions
3-4-9: Violation; Penalty
 
Notes
1 1. 65 ILCS 5/11-55-1.
3-4-1: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this Chapter, the following words and terms shall have the meanings
ascribed to them in this Section:
AMUSEMENT ARCADE: Any business establishment with three (3) or more automatic
devices upon its premises and which allows said automatic amusement devices to
be operated thereon for use in games, contests or amusement through the
exercise of skill.
AUTOMATIC AMUSEMENT DEVICE: Any machine or pool table which, upon insertion of
a coin, slug or token in any slot or receptacle in the machine or attached
thereto, operates for use as a game, contest or amusement through the exercise
of skill. (1997 Code)
3-4-2: LICENSE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful to establish or operate an "amusement arcade", as
hereinabove defined, within the City without first obtaining a license for an
amusement arcade from the licensing authority designated by the City Council.
The licensing authority shall be an officer or agency designated by the City
Council to be the licensing authority for amusement arcades. (1997 Code)
3-4-3: APPLICATION; FEE:
   A.   Application; Required Information: All persons seeking a license shall
submit an application, in writing, to the licensing authority. Upon said
application, the applicant shall furnish to the licensing authority the
following information:
      1.   The names and addresses of all persons, including corporations, in
whose name the application is submitted.
      2.   The address of the location for which the applicant seeks a license.
      3.   The number and type of automatic amusement devices the applicant
proposes to be maintained at said location.
      4.   The criminal felony conviction record of the applicant, or its
officers, if the applicant is a corporation, if any, and, if the applicant does
bear a conviction record of a criminal felony or felonies, any information
which the applicant believes would show that the applicant has been
rehabilitated.
   B.   Action Of Licensing Authority: Within not more than forty five (45)
days of receipt of such application, the licensing authority shall grant or
deny the application for license.
   C.   Fee: The licensing authority shall be empowered to collect with any
application for license or renewal application, any license fee established by
the City Council. (1997 Code)
3-4-4: TERM:
A license, if granted, shall be for a period of one year, and shall be
automatically renewed from year to year thereafter upon application and payment
of the license fee. (1997 Code)
3-4-5: PREMISES REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   Location: No amusement arcade shall be located within three hundred
feet (300') of any church, grammar or secondary school or residential zoning
district unless such amusement arcade was so located prior to the enactment of
this Chapter, or unless the licensing authority waives the requirements of this
provision. Provided, however, that any amusement arcade so located prior to
enactment of this Chapter shall not receive a license pursuant to this Chapter
if at any time following such enactment the automatic amusement devices located
on the premises of such amusement arcade are removed.
   B.   Outside Security Lighting: Outside security lighting must be installed
when such lighting is deemed necessary by the licensing authority and the
licensee is notified of this fact. (1997 Code)
3-4-6: DENIAL, REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION:
A license may be denied, revoked or suspended for one or more of the following
reasons:
   A.   Wilful violation of any provision of this Chapter.
   B.   Conviction of a felony, of any person seeking or holding a license,
under any State or Federal law if the licensing authority determines that such
person has not been sufficiently rehabilitated to warrant the public trust.
   C.   The maximum number of licenses permitted within the City, as the
Council shall from time to time determine, have been issued.
   D.   Wilful violation of any ordnance of the City.
   E.   Failure to submit a license renewal application and pay the required
renewal license fee. (1997 Code)
3-4-7: HEARING PROCEDURE:
   A.   Notice Of Violation: If the licensing authority shall find probable
cause that a licensee or applicant has violated the provisions of this Chapter
or has falsified the application form, the licensing authority shall give
written notice thereof by certified mail addressed to the licensee or
applicant. Said notice shall specify the alleged grounds of said violation and
shall inform the recipient of his/her right to demand a hearing before a
hearing officer designated for such purpose by the licensing authority.
   B.   Demand For Hearing: A demand for hearing shall be made in writing to
the licensing authority and submitted no later than the tenth day next
succeeding the date of mailing of the aforesaid notice. If no demand for
hearing is made within said time, the license shall forthwith be revoked,
suspended or denied.
   C.   Hearing: If a hearing is demanded, it shall be held within ten (10)
days thereafter, upon written notice to the party demanding hearing.
   D.   Hearing Officer: The Hearing Officer for such hearing shall be the
Zoning Officer, which officer is empowered to hear testimony, take evidence,
and to make findings of fact.
   E.   Findings: The Hearing Officer shall thereafter report these findings
along with the Hearing Officer's recommendations to the licensing authority.
   F.   Action Of Licensing Authority: Upon receipt of the Hearing Officer's
findings and recommendations, the licensing authority shall take final action.
(1997 Code)
3-4-8: GENERAL REQUIREMENTS AND RESTRICTIONS:
   A.   Supervision By Adult: All automatic amusement devices within the
premises shall be visible to, and under the supervision of, a person of adult
age.
   B.   Age Limit; Hours: During the regular school year, excepting weekends or
legal holidays, persons under the age of sixteen (16) years shall not be
allowed to operate automatic amusement devices Monday through Friday, between
the hours of eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. and eight o'clock (8:00) P.M., unless
accompanied by a parent or authorized guardian.
   C.   Curfew Enforcement: No persons under the age of sixteen (16) years
shall be allowed to enter or remain inside an automatic amusement arcade after
the time for curfew, if any, for persons that age. (1997 Code)
3-4-9: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
Any licensee who, after notice and hearing, is found to have wilfully violated
any provision of this Chapter shall be subject to the following penalties:
   A.   First Violation: For any first violation, a suspension of license for
any period of time not to exceed thirty (30) days in duration;
   B.   Second Violation: For any second violation, a suspension of license for
any period of time not to exceed ninety (90) days in duration;
   C.   Third Violation: For any third violation or more, either a suspension
of license for any period of time not to exceed one hundred twenty (120) days
in duration or a revocation of license.
In addition to other penalties provided for herein, any person in violation of
this Chapter shall be subject to penalty as provided in Section
1-4-1 of this Code. (1997 Code)
CHAPTER 5
BILLIARD AND POOL HALLS 1
SECTION:
3-5-1: License Required
3-5-2: Application
3-5-3: License Fee
3-5-4: Bond Required
3-5-5: Minors
3-5-6: Hours
 
Notes
1 1. 65 ILCS 5/11-42-2.
3-5-1: LICENSE REQUIRED:
No person shall operate, maintain or conduct a billiard, pool or bagatelle or
pigeon hole table open to the public without first obtaining a license therefor
as provided in this Chapter. (1997 Code)
3-5-2: APPLICATION:
All applications for such licenses as specified in Section
3-5-1 of this Chapter shall state thereon the location of the place of
business, the number of tables to be used and the names and addresses of all
persons owning all or a share of the business. (1997 Code)
3-5-3: LICENSE FEE:
The applicant shall pay therefor such license fee as the City Council shall,
from time to time, determine. (1997 Code)
3-5-4: BOND REQUIRED:
No license required by the provisions of this Chapter shall be issued unless
the application for said license is accompanied by a bond in the amount of two
thousand dollars ($2,000.00) conditioned to indemnify the City for any loss,
damage or liability that may be incurred in the conduct of such business. (1997
Code)
3-5-5: MINORS:
It shall be unlawful for any minor under the age of sixteen (16) years to enter
or remain in any hall licensed under the provisions of this Chapter; provided,
that any such minor may enter if such minor has been ordered to do so by the
direction, consent and knowledge of such minor's parent or guardian, and it
shall be unlawful for the proprietor, owner or person in charge to permit any
violation of the provisions of this Section. (1997 Code)
3-5-6: HOURS:
It shall be unlawful for anyone to permit, or for any place licensed under the
provisions of this Chapter to permit, the operation of, or the being open for
business of such place between the hours of one minute past twelve o'clock (12:
01) midnight and nine o'clock (9:00) A.M. the following morning. (1997 Code)
CHAPTER 6
BED AND BREAKFAST ESTABLISHMENTS 1
SECTION:
3-6-1: Definitions
3-6-2: License Required; Fee
3-6-3: Inspection
3-6-4: Regulations And Minimum Standards
3-6-5: Proof Of Insurance
3-6-6: Renewal
3-6-7: Violation And Noncompliance
3-6-8: Hearing
3-6-9: Penalty
 
Notes
1 1. 50 ILCS 820/1.
3-6-1: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this Chapter, the following words and terms shall have the meanings
ascribed to them in this Section:
BED AND BREAKFAST ESTABLISHMENT: An operator-occupied residence that provides
for a charge accommodation to the public of no more than five (5) guest rooms
and operates more than ten (10) nights in a one year period. Breakfast may be
provided to the guests only. Bed and breakfast establishments shall not include
motels, hotels, boarding houses, or food service establishments.
GUEST ROOM: A sleeping room serving no more than two (2) transient adult guests
per night.
OPERATOR: The owner or the owner's agent who resides in the bed and breakfast
establishment or on contiguous property. (1997 Code)
3-6-2: LICENSE REQUIRED; FEE:
Licensed owner or the owner's agent may apply for a license to operate a bed
and breakfast establishment. No establishment shall be permitted to operate
without such license. Such license application shall be submitted to the City
Clerk along with the following:
   A.   Fee: Licensing fee as determined by the City Council from time to time
to be necessary for the enforcement of these regulations and the processing of
such application.
   B.   Liability Insurance: Proof of liability insurance in such minimum
coverage as the City Council shall deem from time to time as necessary for the
protection of the public.
   C.   Authorization To Inspect: Authorization to permit inspections upon
proper notice and identification of City inspectors including building,
plumbing and electrical inspectors. (1997 Code)
3-6-3: INSPECTION:
Upon receipt of the application and all other necessary information and
documents, the proper inspector or such other employee of the City as is
designated by the City Council shall inspect such establishment to determine
compliance with all applicable City ordinances. Such inspection shall be made
within twelve (12) calendar days. (1997 Code)
3-6-4: REGULATIONS AND MINIMUM STANDARDS:
Bed and breakfast establishments in addition to applicable City ordinances
shall comply with the requirements and minimum standards set forth in the
Illinois Bed and Breakfast Act, 50 Illinois Compiled Statutes 820/1 et seq.,
and any subsequent amendments or revisions of that Act. (1997 Code)
3-6-5: PROOF OF INSURANCE:
The applicant shall provide proof of adequate liability insurance as required
by the licensing agency. (1997 Code)
3-6-6: RENEWAL:
Each application and other requirements as are set forth in Section
3-6-2 of this Chapter shall be submitted, annually, two (2) weeks prior to the
anniversary date of the issuance of the first license. (1997 Code)
3-6-7: VIOLATION AND NONCOMPLIANCE:
If the inspecting authority, after completing an inspection, shall determine
that such establishment has failed to comply with the provisions of this
Chapter or any other applicable City ordinance or State law, such inspecting
authority shall issue a notice in writing. (1997 Code)
3-6-8: HEARING:
   A.   Request For Hearing: Any operator affected by such notice may request,
in writing, a hearing before such body as the City Council shall, from time to
time, deem appropriate for such hearings. Such request must be filed within
five (5) calendar days after receipt by the operator of the notice by certified
mail from the inspecting authority.
   B.   Notice Of Hearing: Such hearing shall be conducted within fifteen (15)
calendar days after receipt by the City Clerk of a request. Notice of the time
and date of such hearing shall be given to the operator five (5) calendar days
prior to the hearing date and delivered by certified mail.
   C.   Action Of Hearing Officer: The Hearing Officer shall conduct a hearing
taking the testimony of the operator and the inspector. Upon hearing such other
witnesses as have relevant information concerning the notice, the Hearing
Officer may extend the time for compliance beyond that provided for by the
inspecting authority, may modify or withdraw the notice, or take such other
actions as is necessary to protect the public and provide substantial justice.
   D.   Decision Of Hearing Officer: The determination of the Hearing Officer
shall be in writing in five (5) calendar days following the hearing unless such
time is extended for good cause. The decision of the Hearing Officer shall be
final. (1997 Code)
3-6-9: PENALTY:
   A.   Revocation Of License: Any operator found to be in violation of any
applicable ordinance including this Chapter or of State law and having failed
to comply with such ordinance or State law upon proper notice shall have their
license revoked after a hearing for that purpose before the Hearing Officer
upon five (5) calendar days notice of the time, date and place of such hearing.
   B.   Misdemeanor: In the event that the Hearing Officer finds at such
hearing that the operator's noncompliance is without reasonable cause or
grounds, such operator shall further be guilty of a misdemeanor and, if
convicted, shall be subject to penalty as provided in Section
1-4-1 of this Code. Each day's violation shall constitute a separate offense.
Such operator may be subject to being charged with such violation either before
or after the hearing provided for in this Section. (1997 Code)
CHAPTER 7
PEDDLERS 1
SECTION:
3-7-1: Definition
3-7-2: License Required; Exception
3-7-3: License Fees
3-7-4: Issuance Of License
3-7-5: Clerk To Keep Register
3-7-6: Hours
3-7-7: Notice Posted On Route 84
 
Notes
1 1. 65 ILCS 5/11-42-5.
3-7-1: DEFINITION:
As used in this Chapter, the following term shall have the meaning ascribed to
it in this Section:
PEDDLER: Any person who engages in the sale or solicitation for sale of any
wares, magazines, services, photographs, nostrums, or any other merchandise of
any kind, or description, when the sale or solicitation for sale of such items
is done from house to house. (1997 Code)
3-7-2: LICENSE REQUIRED; EXCEPTION:
No person shall hawk or peddle goods, wares, magazines, pictures, coupons or
other merchandise within the City limits without having first obtained a
license for that purpose; provided, that this Section shall not apply to
newsboys. (1997 Code)
3-7-3: LICENSE FEES:
The applicant shall pay therefor such license fee as the City Council shall,
from time to time, determine. (1997 Code)
3-7-4: ISSUANCE OF LICENSE:
The City Clerk shall, on written application of any suitable person and the
payment to the Clerk of the license fee as herein provided, issue a license
with the Corporate Seal of the City for the term paid. (1997 Code)
3-7-5: CLERK TO KEEP REGISTER:
The City Clerk shall keep a register of names of the persons to whom such
licenses have been issued, the date and the number of such licenses, the term
for which such licenses are issued, and the date such licenses expire. (1997
Code)
3-7-6: HOURS:
Said license shall only be valid between the hours of nine o'clock (9:00) A.M.
and five o'clock (5:00) P.M. (1997 Code)
3-7-7: NOTICE POSTED ON ROUTE 84:
There shall be posted a notice at the south end of the City limits on Route 84,
at the west end of the City limits on Route 84, at the eastern limits of
Cleveland Road; and at the eastern limits of Poppy Garden Road. Such notice
shall read as follows:
Peddlers are required by ordinance to obtain a license from the City Clerk.
(1997 Code)
CHAPTER 8
FOOD DELIVERY VEHICLES 1
SECTION:
3-8-1: License Required
3-8-2: Application For License
3-8-3: License Fee
3-8-4: Exemption
3-8-5: Sanitation Regulations
3-8-6: Inspections
3-8-7: Revocation Of License
 
Notes
1 1. 65 ILCS 5/11-20-3.
3-8-1: LICENSE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful to use or permit the use of any vehicle, including wagons
and motor vehicles propelled by human power, for the storage or carrying of any
meat, milk, poultry, fish, butter, cheese, lard, vegetables, bread or bakery
products, or any other provisions intended for human consumption, including
beverages, in the City for the purpose of delivering any such foodstuffs to any
place in the City for their use and consumption unless a license for such
vehicle is first secured and the provisions of this Chapter are fully complied
with. (1997 Code)
3-8-2: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE:
Applications for such licenses shall be made to the City Clerk and shall recite
the name and address of the owner of the vehicle, the name of the person for
whom such deliveries are made and nature of the goods carried. The Clerk shall
issue such licenses and shall give to the Mayor a list of all such licenses
issued. (1997 Code)
3-8-3: LICENSE FEE:
The annual fee for such license shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00) for each
vehicle, and shall be issued for one year. Such fees shall be paid to the City
Clerk, who shall turn them over to the City Treasurer forthwith. (1997 Code)
3-8-4: EXEMPTION:
No license fee shall be required for any vehicle used to deliver foodstuffs
from any establishment which is licensed and inspected as a food-dealing
establishment in the City; but all provisions of this Chapter, other than that
providing for the payment of a fee, shall be complied with in connection with
such vehicle. (1997 Code)
3-8-5: SANITATION REGULATIONS:
   A.   Cleanliness: All such vehicles shall be kept in a clean and sanitary
condition and shall be thoroughly cleaned each day they are so used.
   B.   Waste Material: It shall be unlawful to permit stale food, decaying
matter, or any other waste material or product to accumulate in or on any such
vehicle while it is so used.
   C.   Dust; Insects: If unwrapped foodstuffs are transported in any such
vehicle, such goods will be carried in a portion or compartment of the vehicle
which is screened or protected against dust and insects. (1997 Code)
3-8-6: INSPECTIONS:
It shall be the duty of the Mayor to make or cause to be made such inspections
as may be necessary to ensure compliance with the provisions of this Chapter.
(1997 Code)
3-8-7: REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
   A.   Revocation By Mayor: Any license issued under the provisions of this
Chapter may be revoked by the Mayor for any violation of any regulation hereof
and such revocations shall be in addition to any fine imposed by virtue of this
Section.
   B.   Notice Of Revocation: The licensing authority shall give written notice
thereof by certified mail addressed to the licensee or applicant. Said notice
shall specify the alleged grounds of said violation and shall inform the
recipient of recipient's right to demand a hearing before a hearing officer
designated for such purpose by the licensing authority.
   C.   Demand For Hearing: A demand for hearing shall be made in writing to
the licensing authority and submitted no later than the tenth day next
succeeding the date of mailing of the aforesaid notice. If no demand for
hearing is made within said time, the license shall forthwith be revoked,
suspended or denied.
   D.   Hearing: If a hearing is demanded, it shall be held within ten (10)
days thereafter, upon written notice to the party demanding hearing.
   E.   Hearing Officer: The Hearing Officer for such hearing shall be the
Zoning Officer and is empowered to hear testimony, take evidence, and to make
findings of fact.
   F.   Findings: The Hearing Officer shall thereafter report these findings
along with the Hearing Officer's recommendation to the licensing authority.
   G.   Action Of Licensing Authority: Upon receipt of the Hearing Officer's
findings and recommendations, the licensing authority shall take final action.
(1997 Code)
CHAPTER 9
TAXICABS 1
SECTION:
3-9-1: Definition
3-9-2: License Required
3-9-3: Application For License; Fee
3-9-4: Safety Test Required
3-9-5: Insignia; Emblem
3-9-6: Articles Left In Taxicabs
3-9-7: Refusal To Convey Passenger
3-9-8: Fare Payment In Advance
3-9-9: Penalty
 
Notes
1 1. 65 ILCS 5/11-42-6.
3-9-1: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this Chapter, the following word shall have the meaning ascribed to
it in this Section:
TAXICAB: Any public passenger vehicle transporting passengers for hire on a
trip basis to or from a destination as directed by the passenger. (1997 Code)
3-9-2: LICENSE REQUIRED:
No automobile, autocar, cab or other similar vehicle shall be used for the
transportation of persons for hire within the City, whether the said
automobile, autocar or other similar vehicle secures its passengers from a
public stand or stands upon the street or whether the same is kept in a private
garage, unless every such vehicle be licensed as hereinafter provided. (1997
Code)
3-9-3: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE; FEE:
   A.   Form; Required Information: The owner of any such automobile, autocar,
cab or other similar vehicle for which it is desired to secure a license shall
make application to the City Clerk, setting forth therein the name of such
owner, a description of the vehicle for which it is desired to secure a
license, and the place where such vehicle is kept, if the same is kept in a
private garage. The application shall be provided by the said Clerk.
   B.   Bond; Insurance; Certificate Of Safety; Fee: Upon receipt of such
application and upon proof being submitted to the Clerk that the applicant has
complied with the provisions of the Illinois State law pertaining to surety
bonds or insurance policies by reason of the operation of such vehicle, and
upon proof that said vehicle has been tested and a certificate of safety issued
thereon, the Clerk shall issue or cause to be issued a license for such vehicle
upon the payment by the applicant of a license fee as determined from time to
time by the City Council for each vehicle. (1997 Code)
3-9-4: SAFETY TEST REQUIRED:
   A.   Maintenance: Every taxicab operated on streets of the City shall be
kept and maintained in a good and safe mechanical condition.
   B.   Safety Test: Every such taxicab, within fifteen (15) days before
application for license is made, shall be subjected to the safety test provided
by an official testing station as established and set up by 625 Illinois
Compiled Statutes 5/13-101 et seq. Said safety test shall include the testing
and inspection of brakes, lights, horns, reflectors, rear view mirrors, safety
chains, frames, axles, body, wheels, steering apparatus and other safety
devices and appliances. The passing of the safety test shall not be a bar at
any time to prosecution for operating or causing to be operated a taxicab not
in good and safe mechanical condition.
   C.   Display Of Certificate: If the taxicab is in safe mechanical condition,
the operator of the official testing station shall at once issue and affix to
said taxicab a certificate of safety which shall at all times be displayed on
said taxicab.
   D.   Subsequent Certification: No certificate of safety issued during the
second six (6) months of the license year shall be of any effect after the
first day of the succeeding year.
   E.   Testing, Display Required: No taxicab shall be operated upon the
street, alleys or public places of said City without having been tested as
herein required or without having said certificate of safety displayed on said
taxicab. (1997 Code)
3-9-5: INSIGNIA; EMBLEM:
   A.   Required; Specifications: Every automobile, autocar, cab or other
similar vehicle licensed under the provisions of this Chapter shall have the
name of the owner thereof plainly painted in letters at least one and one-half
inches (11/2") in height, and the number of the license plainly painted in
numbers at least four inches (4") in height, in a conspicuous place on the
outside of each side of such vehicle, and such name and number shall be kept so
painted plainly and distinctly at all times while such vehicle is in use during
the continuance of such license.
   B.   Removal: Upon the expiration of such license (unless same is forthwith
renewed) such name and number shall be at once erased from such vehicle and
such vehicle shall not thereafter be used with such name or number thereon.
(1997 Code)
3-9-6: ARTICLES LEFT IN TAXICABS:
Whenever any package, article, baggage or goods of any kind shall be left in or
upon any vehicle licensed under the provisions of this Chapter, the operator of
such vehicle shall, upon discovery of such package, baggage or goods, forthwith
deliver the same to the policeman on duty at the police station in the City.
(1997 Code)
3-9-7: REFUSAL TO CONVEY PASSENGER:
No person licensed as aforesaid when unemployed and his/her legal fare is paid
or tendered to him/her, shall, without lawful excuse, refuse to convey within
the City any person, with or without baggage, as aforesaid when applied to for
that purpose, or having undertaken to convey such person, shall omit or neglect
to do so, under the penalty herein prescribed. (1997 Code)
3-9-8: FARE PAYMENT IN ADVANCE:
Any person licensed as set forth in this Chapter may demand his/her legal fare
to be paid in advance by any person seeking to employ him/her, and may refuse
to convey any person who shall fail to comply with such demand. Any person so
licensed shall give to any person requesting the same his/her name and the
number of his/her license. (1997 Code)
3-9-9: PENALTY:
Every person who shall keep, use or operate, or be in charge, possession or
control of, or cause to be kept, used or operated upon any of the streets or
public ways of the City any automobile, autocar, cab or other similar vehicle
for the conveyance of passengers for hire or reward which has not been licensed
in accordance with the provisions of this Chapter or who keeps, uses or
operates, or causes to be kept, used or operated, any such automobile, autocar,
or other similar vehicle in violation of any of the provisions of this Chapter
shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor. (1997 Code)
CHAPTER 10
SCAVENGERS
SECTION:
3-10-1: Definition
3-10-2: License Required; Fee
3-10-3: Application For License
3-10-4: Liability Coverage
3-10-5: Vehicle Requirements
3-10-6: Sundays Prohibited
3-10-7: Disposal Of Refuse
3-10-1: DEFINITION:
As used in this Chapter, the following word shall have the meaning ascribed to
it in this Section:
SCAVENGER: One who engages in the business or occupation of collecting and
hauling for the purpose of disposal or otherwise, any garbage, refuse, junk or
other trash or material. (1997 Code)
3-10-2: LICENSE REQUIRED; FEE:
It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in the business of a scavenger or
the collection or disposal of animal or vegetable refuse or offal without
having first secured a license therefor. The annual fee for such license shall
be three hundred dollars ($300.00) due May 1 each year. (1997 Code)
3-10-3: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE:
Application for such license to operate in the City as a scavenger shall be
made to the City Clerk, and shall be referred by the City Clerk to the City
Council. No such license shall be issued except on the order of the City
Council. (1997 Code)
3-10-4: LIABILITY COVERAGE:
All applicants shall, when making applications for license hereunder, tender to
the City Clerk a certificate of insurance certifying to liability coverage in
the amount of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) for each accident and
a total aggregate coverage of three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000.00).
(1997 Code)
3-10-5: VEHICLE REQUIREMENTS:
Any vehicle used by such scavenger in his business shall be watertight, and
equipped with airtight covers for such portions as are used for the
transportation of refuse. (1997 Code)
3-10-6: SUNDAYS PROHIBITED:
It shall be unlawful for any vehicle to be driven over or through any street in
the City during or on Sundays. (1997 Code)
3-10-7: DISPOSAL OF REFUSE:
It shall be unlawful for any scavenger to dispose of or store any refuse any
place in the City limits or within one mile thereof without first securing the
written permission of the City Council. (1997 Code)
CHAPTER 11
GARAGE, YARD SALES
SECTION:
3-11-1: Definition
3-11-2: Permit Required; Conditions; Fee
3-11-3: Limitation On Number Of Sales
3-11-4: Record Of Permits
3-11-5: Penalty
3-11-1: DEFINITION:
As used in this Chapter, the following words or terms shall have the meanings
ascribed to them in this Section:
YARD, GARAGE OR BASEMENT SALE: The holding out for sale of any new, used or
antique household goods, utensils or appliances; tools; books; papers or
magazines; bric-a-brac; curios; clothing; jewelry; toys; sporting goods;
cosmetics; or similar household items to the general public and conducted on or
about premises zoned for single or multi-family residential use or used as a
private residence. (1997 Code)
3-11-2: PERMIT REQUIRED; CONDITIONS; FEE:
   A.   Permit Required: It shall be unlawful for any person to conduct a yard,
garage or basement sale, as hereinbefore defined, on or about premises zoned
for residential use unless such person shall first obtain from the office of
the City Clerk a permit for such a yard or garage sale.
   B.   Display Of Permit: The permit must be displayed in a prominent place
during time of sale.
   C.   Duration; Fee: No permit shall be granted or issued for more than three
(3) consecutive days and shall be issued only upon the completion and
submission of an application form approved by the City Clerk, and upon the
payment of a permit fee which the City Council may from time to time provide.
(1997 Code)
3-11-3: LIMITATION ON NUMBER OF SALES:
Yard, garage and basement sales at any one residential location or address
shall be limited in number to no more than six (6) such sales during any one
calendar year and a maximum of two (2) such sales during any one calendar
month. (1997 Code)
3-11-4: RECORD OF PERMITS:
It shall be the duty and responsibility of the City Clerk to maintain a record
of the permits issued and the location for which such permits are issued. (1997
Code)
3-11-5: PENALTY:
Any person in violation of this Chapter shall be subject penalty as provided in
Section
1-4-1 of this Code. Each day a person is in violation of this Chapter shall
constitute a separate violation. (1997 Code)
CHAPTER 12
KENNELS AND PET SHOPS
SECTION:
3-12-1: License Required
3-12-2: Application
3-12-3: License Fee
3-12-4: Investigation
3-12-5: Issuance Of License
3-12-6: Term Of License
3-12-1: LICENSE REQUIRED:
No person shall engage in the business of buying, selling or dealing in birds,
dogs, and other small animals used as household pets and for domestic purposes
without first obtaining a license. (1997 Code)
3-12-2: APPLICATION:
Any person desiring a license required by this Chapter shall make written
application to the City Clerk, stating the name and residence of the applicant
and the place at which the applicant intends or desires to carry on the
business, giving the street location as well as a description of the premises.
(1997 Code)
3-12-3: LICENSE FEE:
   A.   Less Than Twenty: Any person desiring a license required by this
Chapter, where not less than three (3) and not more than a total of twenty (20)
birds, dogs, cats, and other small animals are held for sale as household pets
and for domestic purposes shall pay a license fee of fifteen dollars ($15.00)
annually.
   B.   More Than Twenty: Where more than twenty (20) birds, dogs, cats and
other small animals are held for sale as household pets and for domestic
purposes, the license fee shall be fifty dollars ($50.00) annually. (1997 Code)
3-12-4: INVESTIGATION:
Upon the filing of an application for a license required by this Chapter, it
shall be the duty of the Building Inspector or other person or persons
designated by the City Council to cause an investigation to be made of the
premises named and described in the application for the purpose of determining
the fitness and suitability of the premises for the business from a public
health standpoint. The Building Inspector or other person or persons designated
by the City Council shall transmit to the City Council the application,
together with his/her recommendation for or against the issuance of the
license. (1997 Code)
3-12-5: ISSUANCE OF LICENSE:
If the City Council shall be satisfied that the applicant or its chief
officers, if applicant is a corporation, is in conformity with the provisions
of this Chapter, the City Clerk, upon payment by the applicant of the license
fee prescribed in this Chapter, shall issue a license to the applicant. (1997
Code)
3-12-6: TERM OF LICENSE:
Each license issued shall expire on April 30 following the date of its
issuance. (1997 Code)
CHAPTER 13
TELECOMMUNICATIONS INFRASTRUCTURE MAINTENANCE FEE
(Rep. by Ord. 08-02, 9-9-2002)
CHAPTER 14
AUTOMOBILE SALES AND DEALERSHIPS
SECTION:
3-14-1: Definition
3-14-2: Vehicle Requirements
3-14-3: Business Requirements
3-14-1: DEFINITION:
"Automobile dealership" is defined as a business engaged in the display of
vehicles for sale within the city of Colona which sells four (4) or more
vehicles in any year. Sale of such vehicles need not have occurred on premises.
The display of such vehicles resulting in these sales within a year is to be
enough to meet this definition. (Ord. 0-15-014, 9-15-2015)
3-14-2: VEHICLE REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   All vehicles located on premises for display or sale shall have titles
available on the premises for inspection at all times.
   B.   All such vehicles shall be properly insured and shall meet all state
requirements concerning maintenance and display for public sale. (Ord. 0-15-
014, 9-15-2015)
3-14-3: BUSINESS REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   Any dealership located within the city limits of the city of Colona
shall have its own license to do business and transact such business, and shall
be both licensed and registered with the state of Illinois, and such license
and registration must be available for inspection at all times. The license of
a dealership shall only be for the designated location within the city of
Colona.
   B.   Any business operating under the authority of a license granted by the
state of Illinois by virtue of an exhibition permit for vehicle dealers shall
be required to meet the following obligations in the city of Colona:
      1.   The maximum concentration of vehicles will be determined for each
individual dealership by the zoning officer. In no event shall there be more
than one vehicle for every two hundred (200) square feet of established parking
area on exhibitor's property.
      2.   There shall be an annual license fee payable on May 1 of each year,
in the amount of one hundred dollars ($100.00) in addition to the initial fee
due upon license issuance. If a license is issued at any time during a year
there shall be a proration of the annual fee. All fees are nontransferable.
(Ord. 0-15-014, 9-15-2015)
CHAPTER 14A
USED MOTOR VEHICLES AND PARTS BUSINESSES
SECTION:
3-14A-1: License Required
3-14A-2: Separate License For Each Location
3-14A-3: Application For License
3-14A-4: Investigation Of Application For License
3-14A-5: License Issuance; Rejection
3-14A-6: Persons Eligible For License
3-14A-7: Licensee To Be Owner Or Beneficiary Of Licensed Business
3-14A-8: License Nontransferable Or Assignable; Exceptions
3-14A-9: Expiration Date Of License
3-14A-10: Renewal Of License
3-14A-11: Grounds For Revocation Of License
3-14A-12: Parental Consent Required To Deal With Minors
3-14A-1: LICENSE REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in the business of buying,
selling, exchanging or dealing in used or secondhand motor vehicles and used or
secondhand parts of motor vehicles without first having obtained a license from
the state. Proof of said license shall be submitted to the city.
There shall be an annual license fee payable on May 1 of each year in the
amount of one hundred dollars ($100.00), in addition to the initial fee due
upon license issuance. If a license is issued at any time during a year there
shall be a proration of the annual fee. All fees are nontransferable.
Existing used or secondhand dealerships within the city at the time of passage
hereof shall be grandfathered for the remainder of the year of passage and
adoption of this chapter. The existing licensed dealerships shall not be
transferrable without the permission of such transfer from the city mayor and
council. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-2: SEPARATE LICENSE FOR EACH LOCATION:
A separate license shall be required for each location, place, or premises
where a business or occupation regulated by this chapter is proposed to be
carried on. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-3: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE:
Application for a license required by this chapter shall be made in writing to
the city clerk and shall state the following:
   A.   The name of the applicant, and if a corporation, the names of the
principal officers and the name of one or more persons whom the corporation
shall designate as manager or person in charge;
   B.   The location of the place or premises at or on which it is desired to
carry on such business;
   C.   The length of time which the applicant has resided in the city, or if a
corporation or association, the length of time which the manager or person in
charge has resided in the city;
   D.   What type of shop the applicant maintains in connection with the
principal place of business in the city and whether it is equipped to service
and repair the types of makes of cars which the applicant intends to sell; and
   E.   Such other reasonable and pertinent information as the city council may
from time to time require. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-4: INVESTIGATION OF APPLICATION FOR LICENSE:
Upon receipt of an application for a license required by this chapter, the city
clerk shall refer it to the chief of police, who shall conduct an investigation
to determine whether or not:
   A.   The applicant is a person of good moral character or, if a partnership,
the partners are of good moral character;
   B.   The applicant is a bona fide resident of the state, and the manager of
the applicant's business is a bona fide resident of the city;
   C.   The applicant proposes to engage in a legitimate used car business; and
   D.   The proposed business location would constitute a nuisance, fire
hazard, or in any way jeopardize the safety of citizens. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-
2015)
3-14A-5: LICENSE ISSUANCE; REJECTION:
When the chief of police has completed the investigation required by section
3-14A-4 of this chapter, the application and findings shall be referred to the
city council for further action. If it shall appear to the council from the
investigation by the chief of police that the license applied for should be
issued and the applicable sections of this chapter have been complied with, the
council may direct the city clerk to issue the license; otherwise, it may
reject the application. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-6: PERSONS ELIGIBLE FOR LICENSE:
No license required by this chapter shall be issued to any person unless the
business to be licensed is to be operated by and for the benefit of the person
applying for such license. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-7: LICENSEE TO BE OWNER OR BENEFICIARY OF LICENSED BUSINESS:
It shall be unlawful for a person licensed pursuant to this chapter to engage
in business, delineated in this chapter unless he is the owner of such
business, or unless the business is conducted for the benefit of such licensee.
(Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-8: LICENSE NONTRANSFERABLE OR ASSIGNABLE; EXCEPTIONS:
No license issued pursuant to this chapter shall be transferred or assigned by
the licensee. However, if the business licensed under this chapter descends by
the laws of intestacy, or by devise or bequest comes into the ownership of any
other person, the license shall automatically be transferred to the person who
so acquires such business, subject to compliance with the terms of sections
3-14A-4 and
3-14A-5 of this chapter. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-9: EXPIRATION DATE OF LICENSE:
All licenses issued pursuant to this chapter shall expire on March 31 following
the issuance of such licenses. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-10: RENEWAL OF LICENSE:
All applications for renewal of licenses required by this chapter shall be
referred by the city clerk to the council for its approval or disapproval.
(Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-11: GROUNDS FOR REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
The city council may, at any time, revoke a license issued under this chapter
for any of the following reasons:
   A.   Conviction of the applicant or license holder of the violation of any
section of this chapter or any section of this code which is related to the
licensee's business or any other violation of a statute applicable to the
licensee's business or that would render the licensee an unfit person to
conduct such business;
   B.   The obtaining of or an attempt to obtain a license by fraudulent
misrepresentation;
   C.   Fraud or dishonesty in any transaction relating to such business;
   D.   Failure to keep authentic records of business transaction relating to
such business;
   E.   Failure to maintain a shop in connection with the applicant's principal
place of business in the city tooled and equipped satisfactorily to service or
repair, in accordance with the standards set by the council, the makes and
types of cars sold by the licensee. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
3-14A-12: PARENTAL CONSENT REQUIRED TO DEAL WITH MINORS:
It shall be unlawful for any person licensed pursuant to this chapter to
purchase or receive property from a minor without the written consent of the
minor's parent or guardian. (Ord. 0-15-015, 9-15-2015)
CHAPTER 15
HOTEL/MOTEL TAX
SECTION:
3-15-1: Imposed
3-15-2: Definitions
3-15-3: Collection
3-15-4: Books And Records
3-15-5: Payment
3-15-6: Penalties
3-15-1: IMPOSED:
A tax of five percent (5%) is imposed upon the gross rent charged for the
privilege of renting and using a hotel or motel room within the city of Colona
for each twenty four (24) hour period or any portion of a twenty four (24) hour
period. The tax shall not be levied and imposed upon any person who rents a
hotel or motel room for more than thirty (30) consecutive days or to a person
who works and lives in the same hotel or motel. (Ord. 01-06, 1-23-2006)
3-15-2: DEFINITIONS:
HOTEL/MOTEL ROOM: A room in a structure offered for rental on a daily basis,
excluding permanent residents who occupy a room in excess of thirty (30)
consecutive days. One room offered for rent with or without an adjoining bath
shall be considered a single hotel/motel room. The number of hotel/motel rooms
within a suite shall be computed on the basis of those rooms used for sleeping
purposes.
OWNER: Any person possessing an ownership interest in or conducting or
operating a hotel or motel room or otherwise receiving cash consideration for
the rental of hotel or motel rooms.
PERSON: Any natural individual, firm, partnership, association, joint stock
company, joint adventure, public or private corporation, limited liability
company or a receiver, executor, trustee, guardian or other representative
appointed by order of any court. (Ord. 01-06, 1-23-2006)
3-15-3: COLLECTION:
   A.   The ultimate incidence of liability for payment of the tax is the
person who seeks the privilege of occupying the hotel or motel room, referred
to as the "renter".
   B.   The tax shall be paid in addition to any and all other taxes and
charges. The owner of every hotel or motel shall secure payment of the tax from
the renter of the hotel or motel room.
   C.   The owner shall pay over to the accounts and finance representatives of
the city of Colona the tax under procedures prescribed by the city of Colona or
as otherwise specified in this chapter.
   D.   Every person required to collect the tax shall secure receipt of
payment of the tax from the renter at the time the person who collects the
rental payment for use of the hotel/motel room. (Ord. 01-06, 1-23-2006)
3-15-4: BOOKS AND RECORDS:
The city of Colona accounts and finance department representatives may enter
the premises of any hotel or motel for the inspection and examination of
records in order to assure the proper administration of this chapter, and to
assure the enforcement and collection of the tax. No person shall prevent,
hinder, or interfere with the city of Colona accounts and finance
representatives in the discharge of duties authorized or prescribed under this
chapter. Every owner shall keep accurate and complete books and records,
available for inspection at all reasonable times by the city of Colona,
including a daily sheet showing the number of hotel or motel rooms rented
during a twenty four (24) hour period, including multiple rentals of the same
hotel or motel rooms, and the actual hotel or motel tax receipts collected by
date. (Ord. 01-06, 1-23-2006)
3-15-5: PAYMENT:
   A.   Commencing on March 1, 2006, the owner or owners of each hotel or motel
room within the city of Colona shall file a tax return, showing tax receipts
received with respect to each hotel or motel room during each month, commencing
on or after February 1, 2006. The return shall be due on or before the last day
of each succeeding calendar month and the return shall indicate the monthly
return period. For example a return filed on or before the last day of February
shall indicate tax receipts for the preceding period of January 1 through
January 31. If the owner's average monthly tax receipts do not exceed one
hundred dollars ($100.00) when using as a minimum the last six (6) consecutive
months as a database, the accounts and finance representatives of the city of
Colona may authorize the owner to file a return on a quarterly basis, with
returns for January, February, and March due on or before April 30 of each
year, with the return for April, May, and June due on or before July 31, with
the return for July, August, and September due on or before October 31, and the
return for October, November, and December due on or before January 31.
   B.   If the tax is not paid when due, a penalty at the rate of one and one-
half percent (11/2%) for a thirty (30) day period, or a prorated portion, from
the date of delinquency shall be added to the tax and collected.
   C.   The amounts collected by the city of Colona pursuant to this chapter
shall be expended solely to promote tourism and conventions and to attract
nonresident overnight visitors to the city. (Ord. 01-06, 1-23-2006)
3-15-6: PENALTIES:
Any person found guilty of failing to pay, collect, report, or transmit the
hotel/motel tax to the city of Colona, pursuant to the terms of this chapter,
shall be guilty of a municipal offense. Upon the first conviction of a
municipal offense within a two (2) year calendar period, the fine shall be no
less than two hundred dollars ($200.00) nor more than two hundred ninety nine
dollars ($299.00). A second or third conviction within a two (2) year calendar
period shall be no less than three hundred dollars ($300.00) and no more than
seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00). A separate and distinct municipal
offense shall be committed each day when any person shall continue a violation
of this chapter, or otherwise permit a continuing violation after notification.
(Ord. 01-06, 1-23-2006)
CHAPTER 16
VENDOR MERCHANT
SECTION:
3-16-1: Definitions
3-16-2: License Required; Application
3-16-3: Exemptions
3-16-4: Issuance; Fees; Display
3-16-5: Denial; Revocation
3-16-6: Fixed Location Restrictions
3-16-7: Prohibited Activities
3-16-8: Penalty
3-16-1: DEFINITIONS:
The following definitions shall apply to the interpretation of this chapter:
MOBILE/VENDOR MERCHANT: Any person, the nature of whose business activity
indicates retail sales from a mobile unit and the intent to remain in business
in the city for less than one year, and hereinafter referred to as "vendor".
(Ord. 02-06, 2-13-2006)
3-16-2: LICENSE REQUIRED; APPLICATION:
   A.   It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in the business of a
vendor merchant in the city without first obtaining a license as provided in
this section, excepting as hereinafter provided in section
3-16-3 of this chapter.
   B.   An applicant for vendor merchant license shall give the following
information:
      1.   The name or names of the person having the management or supervision
of applicant's business during the time that it is proposed it will be carried
on in the city and the local address or addresses of such person while engaged
in such business.
      2.   The permanent address or addresses of such person; whether such
person will act as proprietor, agent, consignee or employee and the credentials
establishing such relationship; the name and address of the person for whose
account the business will be carried on, if any; and if a corporation, under
the laws of what state the same is incorporated.
      3.   The place or places in the city where it is proposed to carry on
applicant's business and the length of time during which it is proposed that
said business shall be conducted.
      4.   The place or places other than the permanent place of business of
the applicant, where applicant within three (3) years next preceding the date
of said application conducted a vendor business, stating the nature thereof and
giving the post office box number and street address of any building or office
in which said business was conducted.
      5.   A statement of the nature and character of the tangible personal
property or service to be sold or offered for sale by the applicant in the
city; whether the goods are new, damaged or rejects; whether the same are
proposed to be sold from stock in possession or by sample; where the goods or
products are located at the time said application is filed.
      6.   Whether or not the person having management or supervision of the
applicant's business has been convicted of a felony within the five (5) years
immediately preceding the date of said application or of the violation of any
law or ordinance relating to the same or similar business to be conducted by
applicant, the nature of such offense and the punishment therefor.
      7.   Whether the applicant has ever applied for a license under this
chapter, which has been denied or revoked by another authority in the state of
Illinois.
      8.   A copy of the taxpayer's current state sales tax number and a copy
of any county or state license is required.
      9.   A certificate of insurance for all vehicles used in the operation of
the business is required.
      10.   Copies of any written agreements between the vendor and the owner
of the location where the vendor conducts his business must be on file with the
city. (Ord. 02-06, 2-13-2006)
3-16-3: EXEMPTIONS:
Persons engaged in the following described activities are exempt from the duty
of applying for a vendor merchant license:
   A.   Persons selling at wholesale to merchants for the purpose of the
resale.
   B.   Persons selling or distributing newspapers.
   C.   Persons selling tangible personal property or services to business
enterprises.
   D.   Persons who sell, at their permanent residence in the city, works of
art or crafts made or created by such person or a member of such person's
immediate family.
   E.   Persons licensed by the state to sell real estate or insurance.
   F.   Persons selling or delivering tangible personal property or services
through a permanent business licensed by the city.
   G.   The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to events that are
regulated by the city. (Ord. 02-06, 2-13-2006)
3-16-4: ISSUANCE; FEES; DISPLAY:
   A.   If an application for a one week license under this chapter contains a
complete statement of the information required and all material required to be
submitted therewith is filed with the city clerk, the clerk shall issue the
license. All other licenses for five (5) days and beyond require city council
approval. The license issued hereunder shall not be transferable. There shall
be no refund of the license fee.
   B.   Before a license shall be issued, applicant shall pay to the city clerk
a license fee according to the following schedule:
      1.   For one week, fifty dollars ($50.00) Monday through Friday only.
Holidays are not included.
      2.   For one month, one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00).
      3.   For six (6) months, two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00).
      4.   For one year, four hundred fifty dollars ($450.00).
      5.   Duplicate licenses, five dollars ($5.00).
   C.   Each vendor merchant shall at all times while doing business in the
city keep in the possession of such person the license required by this chapter
and shall display the license as evidence of compliance with the requirements
of this chapter. (Ord. 02-06, 2-13-2006)
3-16-5: DENIAL; REVOCATION:
   A.   The city council may deny a license to any applicant under this chapter
for the following reasons:
      1.   Held a license under this chapter that has been revoked within two
(2) years of the date of the present application.
      2.   Failed to make a complete application.
      3.   During the past two (2) years has a history of:
         a.   Fraudulent applications for similar licenses.
         b.   Misrepresentation of the quality of merchandise or services
offered for sale.
         c.   Crimes involving personal injury.
   B.   The city council may revoke any license issued under the provisions of
this chapter by sending a notice of revocation by certified mail to the license
holder at his last known address, return receipt requested, or by personal
service on the license holder or its officers for any of the following causes:
      1.   Information showing that the license was erroneously issued
initially.
      2.   For any violation of the provisions of this chapter.
      3.   For any violation of any city or state law regulating the sales
activities of the license holder.
   C.   The license shall stand denied or revoked unless within five (5) days
after denial or receipt of the notice of revocation from the chief of police
the applicant or holder files a written request for a public hearing on the
police chief's action. A public hearing shall be conducted before the city
council on whether a license should be denied, reinstated or revoked, as the
case may be. The city council may order the license issued or reinstated either
conditionally or unconditionally, or revoke the license. Thirty (30) days'
notice of the time and place of the public hearing shall be given to the
license holder, who shall have an opportunity to appear before the city council
and present any evidence or arguments he may have why the action taken by the
chief of police should not be approved by the city council. (Ord. 02-06, 2-13-
2006)
3-16-6: FIXED LOCATION RESTRICTIONS:
   A.   No vendor merchant shall engage in business at a fixed location without
the written permission, by lease or otherwise, of the owner or person in
control of the property. This written agreement shall be signed by the parties
and shall include the dates the vendor merchant shall be conducting business.
This agreement shall be submitted as part of the application.
   B.   A vendor merchant doing business at a fixed location shall provide
sufficient off street parking space for his employees and customers.
   C.   Any display of tangible personal property, or signs or advertisements
therefor, shall be at least ten feet (10') from the city's right of way. All
signs and advertisements used in connection with the business licensed in this
chapter shall comply with the provisions of the zoning code of the city of
Colona.
   D.   A vendor merchant doing business at a fixed location shall do so only
in areas properly zoned for business activity. A vendor merchant selling food
items shall comply with all applicable provisions of the health rules and
regulations of Henry County. (Ord. 02-06, 2-13-2006)
3-16-7: PROHIBITED ACTIVITIES:
   A.   No person shall engage in activities regulated under this chapter on
public property without first procuring special authorization from the city
council. (Ord. 02-06, 2-13-2006)
3-16-8: PENALTY:
Any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall, upon
conviction, be subject to a fine not exceeding five hundred dollars ($500.00).
Each sale or solicitation of a sale made without a license or bond in violation
of this chapter shall constitute a separate offense. (Ord. 02-06, 2-13-2006)
CHAPTER 17
FIREWORKS
SECTION:
3-17-1: Permit Required
3-17-2: Application For Permit
3-17-3: Regulations
3-17-4: Fees
3-17-1: PERMIT REQUIRED:
A pyrotechnic display permit must be obtained from the city clerk of Colona in
order to qualify for such displays and all applicants must be adults. (Ord. 11-
06, 5-22-2006)
3-17-2: APPLICATION FOR PERMIT:
   A.   General: The application for such display may be obtained from the
offices of the city clerk of Colona.
   B.   Requirements: The minimum requirements each adult applicant must meet
in order to qualify for issuance of a permit are as follows:
      1.   Applicant must submit a written application for a permit at least
fifteen (15) days in advance of the date of the pyrotechnic display.
      2.   The pyrotechnic display service must be provided by a licensed
pyrotechnic distributor, and the display must be conducted by a licensed
pyrotechnic distributor, and the display must be conducted by a licensed lead
pyrotechnic operator.
      3.   Applicant must show proof of liability insurance in a sum not less
than one million dollars ($1,000,000.00) with an insurance company authorized
to do business in Illinois.
      4.   The fire chief or his designee for the local fire district must
inspect the display site and ensure the display can be performed in full
compliance with the NFPA standards adopted and amended by the OSFM rules, part
235, for the type of pyrotechnic display to be performed. Further, the chief of
the fire department providing fire protection must sign the display permit.
(Ord. 11-06, 5-22-2006)
3-17-3: REGULATIONS:
The permit once issued is not transferable to another person or entity and the
sale, possession, use and distribution of fireworks for display are lawful only
for the purposes given by the permit. (Ord. 11-06, 5-22-2006)
3-17-4: FEES:
The permit fees for department approved fireworks display/pyrotechnic firing
shall be as follows:
Pyrotechnic firing fees:
 
1 - 25 devices    $ 50.00
26 - 100 devices  150.00
101 - 200 devices 250.00
201 plus          350.00
